a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a = prod (\<lambda>i. 1 + 17 / i) {1..19}"
and h1 : "b = prod (\<lambda>i. 1 + 19 / i) {1..17}"
shows  "a / b = 1"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute
\[\frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)}.\] The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)} &= \frac{\dfrac{18}{1} \cdot \dfrac{19}{2} \cdot \dfrac{20}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{19}}{\dfrac{20}{1} \cdot \dfrac{21}{2} \cdot \dfrac{22}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{17}} \\
 &= \frac{\dfrac{36!/17!}{19!}}{\dfrac{36!/19!}{17!}} \\ &= \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a = prod (\<lambda>i. 1 + 17 / i) {1..19}"
and h1 : "b = prod (\<lambda>i. 1 + 19 / i) {1..17}"
shows  "a / b = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Calculate the ratio of the product of terms in the sequence $(1 + \frac{17}{i})$ from $i=1$ to $i=19$ to the product of terms in the sequence $(1 + \frac{19}{i})$ from $i=1$ to $i=17$. The final answer is $1$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 1 \<and> n \<le> 19 \<longrightarrow> f n = 1 + 17 / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 1 \<and> n \<le> 17 \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 + 19 / n"
shows  "prod f {1..19} = prod g {1..17}"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute
\[\frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)}.\] The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)} &= \frac{\dfrac{18}{1} \cdot \dfrac{19}{2} \cdot \dfrac{20}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{19}}{\dfrac{20}{1} \cdot \dfrac{21}{2} \cdot \dfrac{22}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{17}} \\
 &= \frac{\dfrac{36!/17!}{19!}}{\dfrac{36!/19!}{17!}} \\ &= \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 1 \<and> n \<le> 19 \<longrightarrow> f n = 1 + 17 / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 1 \<and> n \<le> 17 \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 + 19 / n"
shows  "prod f {1..19} = prod g {1..17}"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Consider two functions, $f(n)$ and $g(n)$. The function $f(n)$ is defined for $1\leq n \leq 19$ as $f(n) = 1 + 17/n$ and the function $g(n)$ is defined for $1\leq n \leq 17$ as $g(n) = 1 + 19/n$. Is the product of all values of $f(n)$ from $n=1$ to $n=19$ equal to the product of all values of $g(n)$ from $n=1$ to $n=17$?

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n \<in> {1..19}. f n = (1 + 17/n) / (1 + 19/n)"
shows  "prod f {1..19} = 1"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute
\[\frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)}.\] The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)} &= \frac{\dfrac{18}{1} \cdot \dfrac{19}{2} \cdot \dfrac{20}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{19}}{\dfrac{20}{1} \cdot \dfrac{21}{2} \cdot \dfrac{22}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{17}} \\
 &= \frac{\dfrac{36!/17!}{19!}}{\dfrac{36!/19!}{17!}} \\ &= \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n \<in> {1..19}. f n = (1 + 17/n) / (1 + 19/n)"
shows  "prod f {1..19} = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: If a function $f(n)$ is defined for all integers $n$ between 1 and 19 inclusively, such that $f(n) = \frac{1 + \frac{17}{n}}{1 + \frac{19}{n}}$, what is the product of all values of $f(n)$ for $n$ in the given range? The final answer is 1.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> i. i \<in> {1..19} \<longrightarrow> f i = 1 + 17 / i"
and h1 : "\<forall> i. i \<in> {1..17} \<longrightarrow> g i = 1 + 19 / i"
shows  "prod f {1..19} / prod g {1..17} = 1"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute
\[\frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)}.\] The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)} &= \frac{\dfrac{18}{1} \cdot \dfrac{19}{2} \cdot \dfrac{20}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{19}}{\dfrac{20}{1} \cdot \dfrac{21}{2} \cdot \dfrac{22}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{17}} \\
 &= \frac{\dfrac{36!/17!}{19!}}{\dfrac{36!/19!}{17!}} \\ &= \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> i. i \<in> {1..19} \<longrightarrow> f i = 1 + 17 / i"
and h1 : "\<forall> i. i \<in> {1..17} \<longrightarrow> g i = 1 + 19 / i"
shows  "prod f {1..19} / prod g {1..17} = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: Given two functions, $f$ and $g$, defined as follows: $f(i) = 1 + \frac{17}{i}$ for all $i$ in the set $\{1, 2, ..., 19\}$, and $g(i) = 1 + \frac{19}{i}$ for all $i$ in the set $\{1, 2, ..., 17\}$. What is the result of the product of all $f(i)$ divided by the product of all $g(i)$? The final answer is 1.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a = (\<Prod>n\<in>{1..19}. 1 + 17/n)"
and h1 : "b = (\<Prod>n\<in>{1..17}. 1 + 19/n)"
shows  "a / b = 1"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute
\[\frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)}.\] The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)} &= \frac{\dfrac{18}{1} \cdot \dfrac{19}{2} \cdot \dfrac{20}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{19}}{\dfrac{20}{1} \cdot \dfrac{21}{2} \cdot \dfrac{22}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{17}} \\
 &= \frac{\dfrac{36!/17!}{19!}}{\dfrac{36!/19!}{17!}} \\ &= \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a = (\<Prod>n\<in>{1..19}. 1 + 17/n)"
and h1 : "b = (\<Prod>n\<in>{1..17}. 1 + 19/n)"
shows  "a / b = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Given that $a$ is the product of $1 + \frac{17}{n}$ for all integer $n$ from 1 to 19, and $b$ is the product of $1 + \frac{19}{n}$ for all integer $n$ from 1 to 17, prove that the ratio of $a$ to $b$ is 1.

a_5.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x y :: real
assumes h0 : "\<forall> i \<in> {1..19}. x = (1 + 17/i) / (1 + 19/i)"
shows  "x = 1"
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute
\[\frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)}.\] The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)} &= \frac{\dfrac{18}{1} \cdot \dfrac{19}{2} \cdot \dfrac{20}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{19}}{\dfrac{20}{1} \cdot \dfrac{21}{2} \cdot \dfrac{22}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{17}} \\
 &= \frac{\dfrac{36!/17!}{19!}}{\dfrac{36!/19!}{17!}} \\ &= \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes x y :: real
assumes h0 : "\<forall> i \<in> {1..19}. x = (1 + 17/i) / (1 + 19/i)"
shows  "x = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. n \<in> {1..19} \<longrightarrow> f n = 1 + 17/n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. n \<in> {1..17} \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 + 19/n"
shows  "prod f {1..19} / prod g {1..17} = 1"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute
\[\frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)}.\] The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)} &= \frac{\dfrac{18}{1} \cdot \dfrac{19}{2} \cdot \dfrac{20}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{19}}{\dfrac{20}{1} \cdot \dfrac{21}{2} \cdot \dfrac{22}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{17}} \\
 &= \frac{\dfrac{36!/17!}{19!}}{\dfrac{36!/19!}{17!}} \\ &= \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. n \<in> {1..19} \<longrightarrow> f n = 1 + 17/n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. n \<in> {1..17} \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 + 19/n"
shows  "prod f {1..19} / prod g {1..17} = 1"

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f g :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n \<in> {1..19}. f n = 1 + 17 / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n \<in> {1..17}. g n = 1 + 19 / n"
shows  "prod f {1..19} / prod g {1..17} = 1"
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute
\[\frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)}.\] The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)} &= \frac{\dfrac{18}{1} \cdot \dfrac{19}{2} \cdot \dfrac{20}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{19}}{\dfrac{20}{1} \cdot \dfrac{21}{2} \cdot \dfrac{22}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{17}} \\
 &= \frac{\dfrac{36!/17!}{19!}}{\dfrac{36!/19!}{17!}} \\ &= \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n \<in> {1..19}. f n = 1 + 17 / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n \<in> {1..17}. g n = 1 + 19 / n"
shows  "prod f {1..19} / prod g {1..17} = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_7.informal problem: Given two functions $f(n) = 1 + \frac{17}{n}$ and $g(n) = 1 + \frac{19}{n}$, both defined over the natural numbers. $f$ is defined for $n$ in the set {1..19} and $g$ is defined for $n$ in the set {1..17}. What is the result of the product of all values of $f$ divided by the product of all values of $g$? The final answer is 1.

a_8.formal problem:
theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 19 \<longrightarrow> f n = (1 + 17/n)"
and h1 : "\<forall>n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 17 \<longrightarrow> g n = (1 + 19/n)"
and h2 : "product f {1..19} = product g {1..17}"
shows  "product f {1..19} = 1"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Compute
\[\frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)}.\] The final Answer is 1
 ### Proof
 We have that \begin{align} \frac{(1 + 17) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{17}{19} \right)}{(1 + 19) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{2} \right) \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{3} \right) \dotsm \left( 1 + \dfrac{19}{17} \right)} &= \frac{\dfrac{18}{1} \cdot \dfrac{19}{2} \cdot \dfrac{20}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{19}}{\dfrac{20}{1} \cdot \dfrac{21}{2} \cdot \dfrac{22}{3} \dotsm \dfrac{36}{17}} \\
 &= \frac{\dfrac{36!/17!}{19!}}{\dfrac{36!/19!}{17!}} \\ &= \boxed{1}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 19 \<longrightarrow> f n = (1 + 17/n)"
and h1 : "\<forall>n. 1 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 17 \<longrightarrow> g n = (1 + 19/n)"
and h2 : "product f {1..19} = product g {1..17}"
shows  "product f {1..19} = 1"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_8.informal problem: Two functions, $f$ and $g$, are defined such that $f(n) = 1 + \frac{17}{n}$ for all $n$ between 1 and 19, inclusive, and $g(n) = 1 + \frac{19}{n}$ for all $n$ between 1 and 17, inclusive. If the product of all values of $f(n)$ from $n = 1$ to $n = 19$ equals the product of all values of $g(n)$ from $n = 1$ to $n = 17$, then what is the product of all values of $f(n)$ from $n = 1$ to $n = 19$? The final answer is $1$.

 *)

theorem
fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 1 \<and> n \<le> 19 \<longrightarrow> f n = 1 + 17 / n"
and h1 : "\<forall> n. n \<ge> 1 \<and> n \<le> 17 \<longrightarrow> g n = 1 + 19 / n"
and h2 : "prod f {1..19} = prod g {1..17}"
shows  "prod f {1..19} / prod g {1..17} = 1"
